cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles NNE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast across central Cuba tonight, then turning north-northwest and west toward South Florida/Florida Keys and into the southeast Gulf of Mexico, keeping the broader cone over the Florida peninsula through mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Florida Keys / extreme South Florida

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida west coast from north of Bonita Beach to Englewood (includes Manatee County area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida coast from Jupiter Inlet south-westward to Bonita Beach, including the Keys and Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Florida, the Florida Keys, and much of the Florida west coast up through the Tampa Bay region
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) are possible at the port Monday night through Tuesday with a 32 % cumulative chance and peak probability Tuesday night–Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft above ground level possible along the west-central Florida coast, including Tampa/Manatee Bay, especially at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands associated with Eta could total 4–8 inches at the port, with locally higher amounts, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Occasional tornadoes in outer rain bands and hazardous seas/rough surf affecting vessel operations in Tampa Bay approaches.
